channel.title: JAVAC Question
channel.description:
I know this has been asked a million times or more, and i know i have asked this in the past.
I recently got a new computer, and wanted to get back to server coding, i know all my coding stuff, and i still have my old source, anyway..
My question is: When i see "'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command.." what do i have to download? I forget!
Please and thank you.. I also ask that you respect me, and my question, the first bit of spam, flame, or anything of that nature will be reported to a mod. BTW This is my new account because the email to my old account i have forgotten, and i forgot my password..

item.title: JAVAC Question
item.dc:creator: @H2O H2O
item.description:
@H2O wrote:

JDK, thank you, that was it.
I tried Googling it, but it came up with so many different downloads i didn’t know what one to choose.

Thanks buddy

Environmental Variables… hmm.

Read full topic

item.title: JAVAC Question
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

You need to download JDK and set your environmental variables. If you don’t know how, remember that Google is your friend.

Read full topic
